intro: Alectorolophus hercegovinus, commonly known as the Hercegovańský kaktus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
